alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 04 at 6:20PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: .Mendenhall Lake gauge levels along with imagery from Suicide Basin indicate that the basin has started its release of water into the Mendenhall lake. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst is expected. * WHERE...The Mendenhall Lake and River around the glacier visitor center, the Mendenhall campground, Skaters Cabin Road, View Drive and possibly below Back Loop bridge. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations near Mendenhall Lake and River is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6 PM AKDT, the USGS gauge reports showed rising levels on Mendenhall Lake consistent with a release of water from Suicide Basin. Water levels have been rising at a rate of around two tenths of a foot per hour. The imagery of Suicide Basin confirms the start of a release. Flooding is expected to begin shortly, especially near the Mendenhall Lake and River. - For Mendenhall Lake : At 6:15pm the stage was 7.35 feet. Flood Stage is 9.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 10.75 feet is expected around 10:00pm Saturday which puts the lake above the moderate flood stage of 10.0 feet. Impacts: At 7.7 feet: Nugget Falls trail begins to flood near the beginning of the trail. Along the Mendenhall River some sections will experience bank erosion resulting in dangerous tree fall. These conditions could make floating the river more hazardous with the higher water levels. At 9.0 feet: Water covers Skaters Cabin Road between Skaters Cabin and West Glacier Trailhead, also water will flow into the Mendenhall Lake Campground. At 9.4 feet: The yards along View Drive will start to flood and cause minor flooding. At 9.6 feet: There will be 7 inches of water over the Skaters Cabin Road between Skaters Cabin and West Glacier Trailhead. Campsite 7 will be flooded as well as water flowing over the road between campsites 8 and 9 in the Mendenhall campground. At 10.0 feet: Water levels will inundate Mendenhall Campground with up to 3 feet of water covering low areas as well as up to 1.5 feet of water covering Skaters Cabin Road. Portions of West Glacier Trail will be impassable. At 10.4 feet: Significant flooding along the Mendenhall Lake area with more than 3 feet of water in places and the Mendenhall campground will be evacuated. Some homes along View Drive will have up to 3 ft of water in yards. - Inherent uncertainty in initial glacier lake volume will result in varying crest height and timing.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
